x26lHzMJk1g.title: This Combo is just BROKEN in Oaken Tower
x26lHzMJk1g.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vApiI3Ez6A&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7AiSFN60y-_fm7JlW04peCe
Today we explore a broken Combo in Elve- I mean Oaken Tower: The Evlish Orb. The Elvish Orb gives +1 Multicast to an Elven item - permanently, not temporarly. For that it needs 12 seconds and that's the biggest issue, to either survive that long or to not kill the enemies prior to it triggering. And that's the real issue, even though it may sound nice to destroy the enemies, at one point you will get overpowered and die so fast that Elvish Orb also can't trigger, going into a cycle of repeated losses until the game is over. So the plan is simple: Get Lost Fragment below an optimally upgraded Elvish Orb so it will double trigger, giving +4 Multicast immediately, which is usually enough to win the game or at least to get very far.

Oaken Tower is a synergy-heavy PvP autobattler where your tower of items fights other players. Build deadly combos and scale exponentially. Every decision matters.

in_g76pWO4I.title: I Beat the HARDEST Difficulty in Bounty of One with GARLIC | Infamy 50
in_g76pWO4I.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7CMXM4UjhBUKfNkwfVLd4eD
Today we play Bounty of One and take on the highest difficulty possible - Infamy Level 50. It would be too much to put everything in here, but how about: Bouncing enemy projectiles, 5 times the damage and no healing is dropped? Yea, that sounds quite insane and is just a small part of the package. This time I am not allowed to make use of the "reroll banish exploit", or how I would call it: Using our brain. The "exploit" allows you to banish everything you roll through at once, so you are left with mostly legendary and mythical upgrades. Jokes aside, this does make the run a lot harder and/or a lot more serious, so there is left space to goof around and it shows in the final boss fight.

6eE4uzeI0eo.title: The 2 Most Broken Multicast God Builds in Oaken Tower
6eE4uzeI0eo.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vApiI3Ez6A&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7AiSFN60y-_fm7JlW04peCe
Today in Oaken Tower we have 2 amazing Multicast runs and one of them is very different from the norm, as it's one I've never seen before: The Elven Poison shield. With the Elven Orb we stack a ton of multicast on it, but one thing is missing: actual damage. So we take the Elven book to increase it's damage AND we multicast said book to multiply the damage faster and faster. In the second run we go for a more typical multicast with the Lunar Codex, slap a bunch of potions on it and since it now has bleed, we can combine it with Shardfang - a legendary dagger that attacks whenever we apply bleed (which we do a ton per attack), and helps us deal a lot more damage until Warhorn kicks in and explodes the damage of Lunar Codex.

Oaken Tower is a synergy-heavy PvP autobattler where your tower of items fights other players. Build deadly combos and scale exponentially. Every decision matters.

✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vApiI3Ez6A&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7AiSFN60y-_fm7JlW04peCe
Today in Oaken Tower we check out the Axes in the game, as I started to try out different things and found insane success with them. Over 5 games I had 5 10/0 games (10 wins, 0 losses) and 1 10/1 game. The reason it's so absurd is that your starting core is already strong compared to many other builds, the Chopper scales up the damage of all Axes. Once you get to Epic levels relatively easily due to the damage scaling, you can either look to further advance the build or if you can't find the pieces, pivot into another build while using the power of the axes to not lose fights.

9IPMrZwI4qk.title: I BROKE This New Brotato Tower Defense With MONEY in Book Shooter
9IPMrZwI4qk.description:
✵Game on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/3551370/Book_Shooter/
Today we check out Book Shooter, a game that pretty much combines Brotato and Tower Defense into one, a Horde Survivor where you stay stationary and slay the enemies - or a no movement challenge in Brotato. What starts out as a greedy take on the game where I want to maximize damage quickly turns out of control as I earn a ridiculous amount of money and buy everything without having to think about it. Eventually I realize that the equivalent to "Harvesting" in Brotato, Gathering, triggers every 10 seconds instead of at the end of the wave, the game is completely out of control. The cherry on the top is a combination of skills that allow us to scale up infinite amount of damage and more (honestly, so much I forgot what is all affected) and we don't even need to attack anymore to win. 

Book Shooter is a rougelike game that combines many different gameplays. There are a lot of magic, magic books, and enemies in the game. Come and fight!

Today in Oaken Tower we try out Wild Magic - or how I call it, Content Book. The starting strategy was to level up quickly to level 3 to have good chances at Epics and the plan worked out, as Wild Magic is an epic. Wild Magic transforms the item to it's right into another random item, permanently. We lucked out by first getting Serpentfang, a Dagger that triggers when you apply Bleed to enemies, and soon after we get Midas Diary, an item that gives +2 Gold EVERY TIME a Dagger triggers.

Needless to say: We turned broken.

WOItTcayUtY.title: I created the Perfect EXODIA of Destruction in Godslayer Arena
WOItTcayUtY.description:
✵Game on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/2870430/Godslayer_Arena/
Today we go back to Godslayer Arena and start out innocently with a slight focus on making more use of the traits, whiiiich...yea, quickly turned into utter apocalypse. It all started with a ring that gives 4 experience per active trait, so even with just 5 traits active we'd get double the amount of XP we get per round, or the equivalent to skipping additional rolls. But why stop there? Get a legendary spell on top that casts like crazy, bonus mana, attack damage and spellpower per unique trait and nothing stays alive.

Godslayer Arena is a roguelike fusion of autobattlers and action-rpgs. Combat is performed completely automatically. Understanding complex interactions between the spells, gems, and items you draft will be key to success. Break the game. Become overpowered.

X_woTJ8Qs3c.title: I looted Monsters for LEGENDARY Equipment MAX | Overlooting
X_woTJ8Qs3c.description:
Today we check out Overlooting again as the last run is now 3 months ago and this time we stumble upon an absolutely broken trait: Wood, or what it's actually called: Villager. The first level of the trait gives you better items as if you progressed 10 more areas, but the second level at 5 pieces turns that into 20 areas. That means in area 7 we would actually get loot from area 27, or in other words: we almost only see the highest level equipment possible, leading to an absolutely broken build.

Adapt your strategy to a skill tree that changes every run, combine pieces of equipment to form powerful synergies and create a game-changing build capable of defeating the bosses that will try to stop you. In this Inventory Management Roguelike two games never feel the same!

Today we check out the newest DLC of Nordic Ashes, Remnants of Corruption, and have a blast conquering the normal and hard difficulty tower in it. While I was looking for the link to the DLC I came across a mixed set of reviews on it and I am honestly surprised, since I really enjoyed it and thought it's a perfect twist on the already existing game - keeping what's fun but offering an alternative route so players can have different experiences depending on what they feel like. We end up playing as Blud, a character that constantly loses HP but can life leech...I think at least...and demolish the boss in the first run so fast that I didn't even notice it. In the hard run we used Kaos and it was...chaos. That's as much as I will spoiler about it.

HiuE5BS0Xu4.title: This Game wants You to Destroy your Keyboard
HiuE5BS0Xu4.description:
✵Game on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/2874130/Berserk_or_Die/
Smash or pass? Definitely smash. Today we check out Berserk or Die, a game from Nao Games but published by our beloved Poncle, the team behind Vampire Survivors. In Berserk or Die one message is clear: Destroy your keyboard. The more you smash the harder you strike, using half of your keyboard to attack left and the other half to attack right. While it took some time to get used to it (and some workarounds using the mouse...) I started enjoying the game more and more and hope you also have a blast.

This is an action game in which players attempt to survive by defeating a number of enemies which appear from the left and right sides of the screen. Use a unique keyboard-banging control scheme for maximum dopamine! Go Berserk, or Die!

X_5EadOngi0.title: I beat Hardest Difficulty with 0 Items in Brotato Abyssal Terrors
X_5EadOngi0.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors I take on a challenge I was working on for a while: Win on Danger 5 with 0 items. At first this doesn't sound that bad, but each character I attempted this with struggled at different points - mostly against some of the later waves, the Elite or the final boss fight, but for different reasons. Loud for example can build up a lot of Attack Speed, but most runs ended rather early since it becomes insanely difficult to survive the enemies without healing from material or buying armor and melee damage items. Another problem with these challenges is that I may have the best character but due to a few unlucky runs I stop playing them. Today I went for Vagabond for the first time after getting too frustrated that I always had a few good stats but others were completely lacking, ending in a loss - and Vagabond let's all weapons count as every class so you get max bonuses from each weapon class equipped. While this does compensate for a lack of general stats, it relies a ton on what weapons you find and what level up stats you get to round up your build.

lxiOYVKh9_Q.title: I ONE SHOT the BOSSES (33,206 HP Wave 20) in Brotato
lxiOYVKh9_Q.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as Loud with one simple but yet very complicated goal: One shot the Bosses at Wave 20. Reaching high damage numbers in Brotato is not hard to achieve if you go for Endless Mode, but the moment you get limited to just 20 waves you have way less options - and need way better RNG - to reach enough damage to one shot the bosses. How much? 33,206 Damage. So what's the plan? The rough plan is to get Obliterator as it's 1500% Ranged Damage scaling is the most absurd damage scaling on any weapon in the game, Cursed this can be up to 3150%. With a Crit that deals x2.3 damage, that goes up to 7245% Damage scaling, all of which lowers the Ranged Damage and %Damage requirement. So the plan is simple, but finding what you may as well call Exodia is what makes this so hard. Even if you find all the damage pieces, without enough economy you won't be able to get enough Ranged and %Damage, so a lot has to work out right.

oS3eVrxtidY.title: Crazy Attack Speed Immortal Thief Build in Endless Mode | Conquest Dark
oS3eVrxtidY.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vRXmxQDA3jw&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7BJ7feu_e5KRasCxxdHvxYc
Today we play more Conquest Dark and after a bit of a jump into the future now have access to the Thief, among...all other characters and most unlocks. Yea I played quite a bit on my own and we do this here to farm up resources. But today I want to go for an endless run in the arena of Conquest Dark and attempt a theory I had for an immortal build. It relies on dodges - not dashes, those are a separate thing - as dodges avoid a normal hit on you. I say normal because I know of 2 exceptions, but we won't encounter these. Now that sounds fine and good, but we'd run out of dodge charges right? Wrong, that's where we use the Artifact Edge of Darkness, which has a 10% chance (affected by proc chance bonuses) to refill ALL of your dodge charges hit a single hit. So I want to focus on multi-attacks and attack speed on our primary weapon as much as possible that we can be as safe as possible.

Today we check out Castle Craft, a very fun game that combines Minecraft with a tower defense - or should I say castle defense? - into 1 game. Or maybe that it's just a better execution of what Minecraft Legends tried to be...The game in it's core is relatively simple: Farm up basic resources, build defenses, destroy enemies and protect the king. Each round you earn currency to get more unlocks and you have to decide how greedy you can afford to be, as going too much for economy may end up in the fragile king's death.

vc4YG7OlfmU.title: I BROKE Dungeon Clawler with INFINITY NaN
vc4YG7OlfmU.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7B0NqrHUe0yO1Hhx3qckULU
Today in Dungeon Clawler we play as the new character Astrobun again - but this time not to mess around, but to break the game. Not...just reaching a high number, but literally making it impossible to continue and being forced to quit out of the game. How? I'd say it's best to watch the video, I tried to cut it short that everything is rather quickly revelead, but as a small tip: Multiplicative multipliers is the keyword. Additive multipliers are something like crit damage, where you deal x2 damage, if you increase that you can deal x3, x4, x5, the point is the actual multiplicative damage is being added on top of. But multiplicative multipliers go from x2 to x4 to x8 to x16 and so on. So if you find a way to trigger these often enough, it gets ridiculous VERY fast.

8-0M4zVihiw.title: I Won WITHOUT Moving ONCE in Megabonk
8-0M4zVihiw.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hyApNptjgdQ&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DZZtIfKIK6JrfOMwlIO1TB
Today in Megabonk I try to win without moving once. Now I define a win as getting to 0 minutes since this then spawns the endless waves, meaning you made it through the game and are now on a timer to die. That said, if you think a win would be a boss kill, I totally understand that - and the main reason I didn't even mention that in the video is that I simply haven't thought about it, since you can do the boss kill at any point or even never, but hitting 0 is always guaranteed to happen. So for me the boss is rather an additional thing. To say this challenge was tough would be an understatement and when you see the winning run you'll understand what was needed to get there. Pretty much 3 things had to work out, 2 of those just at the right moment.

7NqrJLR9ZoM.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3UxOq0xDjKs&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DQbJVaOmBRe3nA2RfzYR_r
Today I want to 100% Vampire Survivors first DLC Legacy of the Moonspell, starting off where we stopped in the first 100% video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3UxOq0xDjKs. While the DLC "only" contains 21 Unlocks, there were also a few more that came up from Vampire Survivors itself due to updates over time - meaning today we will also unlock the secret character Bats, finish the 2 adventures World of Light and Dark and A Garlic Paradise, and also unlock the Darkasso Relic in Room 1665 with all 5 of them collected.
Legacy of the Moonspell takes us into a fantasy world full of magic and monsters as we have to fight through a rather tough but ginormous map you can easily get lost in. While it can be seen that the oldest DLC lacks a bit in comparison to newer ones, it should be kept in mind that it's dirt-cheap at only $2 and for that is 100% worth it's value.
The DLC contains the new characters Miang Moonspell, Menya Moonspell, Syuuto Moonspell, Babi-Onna, McCoy-Oni, Megalo Menya and Syuuto Moonspell, as well as Gav'et-Oni.

OnL9gjgjJbg.title: I created the PERFECT Harvesting God in Brotato
OnL9gjgjJbg.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as Farmer, Entrepreneur and Baby at the same time to create a Harvesting God. Farmer gains Harvesting per consumable picked up at full HP and also increases the end of round Harvesting bonus from 5% to 8%. Entrepreneur may not initially strike one as a part of the trio, but he reduces prices by 25% to buy more and scale faster while also increasing Harvesting bonuses by 50%! Yes, that's a huge chunk. And Baby reduces prices by another 20%, so we can buy even more, while also providing us with a total of 24 weapon slots, meaning 24 cursed gardens that at the same time increase in damage the more Harvesting we have. One Brotato I banished was Druid, just because Druid on his own is already insanely broken and the run would rather deviate away from being about Harvesting into being about just fruits, as you have a chance to gain Luck per fruit picked up. Which is crazy, don't get me wrong, but not really the goal of this.

✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7B0NqrHUe0yO1Hhx3qckULU
Today in Dungeon Clawler we play as Toxicarl, the latest new character added to the game. Toxicarl is all about poison, with his unique item the Toxicarl's Flask, which stacks up in poison it applies for each enemy dying to poison while it's still in the item pool. After starting off with a poison potion that can triple poison on the enemy, I decided to ask you guys if you want to go for a reset-run, meaning we quit out if we don't get something good and do it again. That said, just because that can be done doesn't change that much. As in yes, you can reset for what you want if it's there, but the game highly limits what's available. E.g. with Perks, sometimes just 1 of them or none at all will change, no matter how often you reset.

✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hyApNptjgdQ&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DZZtIfKIK6JrfOMwlIO1TB
Today we continue with Megabonk and what originally started as a "try out" video I do on my own - and lately started uploading on my second channel - quickly turned into a run where everything just worked out. Now if you ask me "Dex, do you think the Fox is the best now?" I would 100% say: No, we got carried hard by having the damage multipliers and it would have been so much better if we had 100% Crit Chance, instead of the low amount we had. That said though, I think it's still incredible that the character you start with and is arguably the worst out of all is right now the one that holds my highscore - and got me into the top 200.

8FzAJhCXAto.title: I got a GOD RUN in Megabonk Top 250 World
8FzAJhCXAto.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hyApNptjgdQ&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DZZtIfKIK6JrfOMwlIO1TB
Today we continue with Mega Bonk and try out Calcium - a Skeleton Buddy that starts out with Bone and gains movement speed periodically when not hit, though that may have a cap. And notably, if you block or dodge an attack, it does not count as a hit. While it started off relatively calm, even the first fun run got the furthest I've ever been. So in the second run I decided to go the build we figured out in the last run including XP, Difficulty and Luck Tome. Little did I know this would be the most broken run I've ever had and it's not even close, taking me into the top 250 worldwide.

WH7rzv7hcos.title: I turned into SUPERMAN in Megabonk
WH7rzv7hcos.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hyApNptjgdQ&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DZZtIfKIK6JrfOMwlIO1TB
Today we continue with Mega Bonk after we Clank - or Cl4nk - and want to test him out. Cl4nk gets 1% Crit Chance per level up and starts with the Revolver, which is a very fun weapon that relies on projectiles and bounces. After an amazing first run that sent us flying I realize I never got the unlocks for the Luck, Difficulty (Curse) and XP Tomes, so I ended up going for a second run that turned out to be absurdely lucky. Now overall, I definitely need to balance damage and economy upgrades better, but I really feel like the Pistol is sadly just not good. Similar to other projectile weapons it can't attack fast enough to deal with the insane enemies in the lategame that are so fast they borderline break sound barriers. But I definitely think I am on track to get a decent kill record going.

N3w1ERVmftE.title: The New GOD of Brotato
N3w1ERVmftE.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we settle once and for all why Druid has overtaken the old God, Demon. Demon is still very strong, but falls short scaling wise the further you go. Druid on the other hand can increase his damage so ridiculously high with multiplicatively scaling - he makes use of the items that scale with the constantly increasing Luck, so their base damage goes up, but then also converts Luck into %Damage. In our case we went crazy and hit 52% Damage per 10 Luck, or in other words 52 Pearls worth of Cursed Pearls.

5mzWkYOpFCE.title: BROTATO GOD RUN! 34 Baby With A Beard Bullet Storm Insanity
5mzWkYOpFCE.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we do something quite different - we combine a fun idea together with the goal of becoming broken, by stacking as many Baby with a Beard as we can. This doesn't sound like a very broken thing, but for every Baby a dying enemy will shoot out 1 Bullet - so if you have 10 of them, it's 10 bullets. If then 5 enemies die from that, it's 50 bullets. You can see how that escalates quickly. Oh, and this run was pretty much an insane god run.

ttZiuRjp0w8.title: 2 Legendary Yorick Broke My Record in Balatro
ttZiuRjp0w8.description:
Today we are back with some more Balatro - this time it's a bit different though, since I didn't intent to even record. Initially the run was just a random fun run where I got 4 retrigger on the first card played, so e.g. a +3 Gold card now gets triggered 5 times, giving 15 Gold instead.  But I didn't realize yet that the main trickster is on it's way: Yorick. Not just 1, but 2. Yorick multiplies the multiplier, which increases by 1 every 23 discards - meaning now every 23 discards we increase it twice by 1. And since they multiply each other as well, it's a lot crazier.

EQ3tLIZmBf8.title: I Exploited Bounty of One for MOST BROKEN RUN Youve Ever Seen
EQ3tLIZmBf8.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7CMXM4UjhBUKfNkwfVLd4eD
Today we play Bounty of One again and as it's probably the last episode of this short re-visit to the game, I wanted to make sure we go out with a bang. Thanks to you guys we figured out 2 crucial elements of the game, for starters as long as nothing is chosen in the starter sheriff chest, I can just alt+F4 to start a new run that still has the chest - usually you have to beat the first Sheriff and quit out to get it. This makes resetting for the right starting object WAY faster. Second, and more importantly, one of you has figured out that rolling and then banishing all choices does not just banish the current choices, but also the ones we rolled over. So if the stars align and we (finally, because this took several tries) get just the right rolls to banish the things we don't want, we are just left with insane mythical upgrades.

0hF3nfC6lKQ.title: I hit E-VALUES in Bounty of One?! (Over 100M Damage)
0hF3nfC6lKQ.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7CMXM4UjhBUKfNkwfVLd4eD
Today we play Bounty of One again - after Real Civil Engineer reminded me of this gem, so thank you for that - but with the goal of reaching completely absurd damage numbers. No, I don't mean damage to one shot a boss, I don't mean 100,000 or even 1,000,000, I want to go above and beyond to hit numbers you may not have even known existed in this game - the E-values. E just refers to how many spots you have to move over the comma, so a 1E+07 is the same as 10,000,000, while 1E+08 is then 100,000,000 or 100 Million.

zezkXakRZMM.title: This hidden OP Stratgey is actually BROKEN! | Brotato Abyssal Terrors
zezkXakRZMM.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as Romantic and this time with a new OP strategy I thought of a while ago but couldn't quite get to work. Now each strategy or build has its own strengths and weaknesses, but it mostly depends what they are for - in this case, it's for Endless only, mostly since it's a bit difficult to get everything in time. Don't get me wrong, you can still beat Danger 5 Classic Brotato with it as shown here, but it's way harder than some other strategies. So what do we do? We spam turrets. Romantic has a chance to charm enemies with each hit he lands once they reach 25% HP - this also includes the damage turrets deal. So the plan is to get a ton of turrets with a ton of attack speed, proc Giant's Belt like stupid and then charm them to finish them off. That last part sounds a bit sus.

z584G5GwJPU.title: I found the ULTIMATE Legendary Upgrade in Everwarder
z584G5GwJPU.description:
✵Game on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/2307170/Everwarder/
Today we check out Everwarder, a very fun game that is best described by taking Dome Keeper, minimizing mining and maximizing tower defense. You spawn in a randomly generated area and have to place down Crystals to mine out the surrounding area. Whenever a block is mined, an enemy spawns and wants to attack your Crystal, which is your base you have to protect. Enemies have 3 different types, indicated by their spawn area, and the game follows a simple rock-paper-scissor-principle, where a tower can deal 2x, 1x or 0.5x damage based on it's own and the enemy type. As we dig through the enemy blocks we also discover artifact fragments, once 5 are collected we get to choose an artifact. These will give the tower it's meant for a special effect, while the others receive an increase to their Gem amount - and Gems are what determine how strong an upgrade is for that tower. So eventually you have to decide if you want to give your main tower a special effect, or if you want to instead get one for another tower but it will give more gems to the main tower, which then upgrades all the other upgrades you have unlocked for it.

In our run I end up finding a broken combo that allows infinite damage growth by killing enemies, and infinite health growth by consuming their remains. What could possibly go wrong with a fully evolved monstrosity that scaled up it's damage and health like stupid?

✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as Renegade, a character that gains +2 Projectiles on his weapons at the cost of losing 80% Damage scaling - and starting with -80% Damage. This is a severe cost to his scaling overall, but one thing doesn't care about that at all: Giant's Belt. In general, Shurikens can struggle a lot to get going, but with 2 additional projectiles it's easier to cover yourself, making sure you need less attack speed and range to get to a point of safety, but now it's even more important to scale up damage until you reach the point of insanity.

25-uvUtBYQg.title: Boogaloo of Illusions Goddess Succubus hitting 500,000 Curse | Vampire Survivors Ode to Castlevania
25-uvUtBYQg.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DuJpa1e8YUnaPTSoHyVI7S
Today in the Vampire Survivors DLC Ode to Castlevania we play as Succubus - a character made for me as she starts with Boogaloo of Illusions, an Arcana that has a long history on my channel. Each level up grants us an additional 1% Area, meaning our weapon will turn ginormous - but on top of that, the pool of the weapon also gives 100% bonus Curse on top of our Curse. So if we have 1000, 1 pool will increase it to 2000, 2 pools to 3000, 4 pools to 5000 and so on. While we are enjoying the absurd growth of the weapon, I come across a minigame to attempt to reach the highest Curse stat I've ever had on an unegged character.

F7PMNjmQj_A.title: The secret Pacifist God Mode technique | Brotato Abyssal Terrors Modded
F7PMNjmQj_A.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors combine the Pacifist, the Explorer and the Cryptid into 1 character - meaning we spawn a ton of trees, gain bonus material out of that and don't want to kill enemies to get more material from the Pacifist. Not that we could though since we only deal 1 damage and with our insanely negative %Damage, there is also no fast way to change that. While playing I got quite surprised how the run felt quite good, like a normal character would. It's pretty much just a Pacifist run but removes a lot of frustration and replaces it with fun. The map is bigger and a minigame is added to avoid all trees. Once enough spawned, the additional healing from Cryptid (3 HP Regeneration per Tree) keeps us alive. But there is a tipping point - the Giants Belt. This must be one of the most hilarious things I personally experienced in Brotato, seeing our weapon deal a miniscule amount of damage but slapping the enemies out of existence due to the Giants Belt effect.

4WvkMvcRjho.title: The PERFECT Weapon for Baby (wanted by you) | Brotato Abyssal Terrors
4WvkMvcRjho.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as the Baby and go for what should be the perfect weapon - the Captain Sword. Baby can have up to 24 weapon slots and the Captain Swords gains 25 (or 50 upgraded) bonus damage per empty weapon slot. So it should be the perfect weapon for the Baby, right? Just instantly becoming an insane nuke? Technically yes, but the main issue is the rarity of the weapon - and on top of that the Baby is one of the worst characters in the game according to my own subjective feeling. Without stat level ups, you lack so many stats that you build up over time that it's hard to make anything work that's not completely broken (like Sticks).

Today we go back to Epic Auto Towers, a fun auto battler that combines typical Tower Defense with Super Auto Pets into a lot of fun. After we went extreme in the first episode, today we continue with a new fun thing I came across: Hydra Towers. The Hydra gives itself percentage bonus stats based on it's level, while when a Hydra gets defeated, an extra Hydra tower is added to the shop - and best of all, for each Hydra tower we have, the cost of them is reduced by 1, so they are eventually free. The real question is though: Just how insane can we turn the Hydra tower and how far can we get in Endless?

a1s9UaTsCKA.title: I became the ultimate immovable Heal Tank | Brotato Abyssal Terrors Modded
a1s9UaTsCKA.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as Old - not just once, but 3 times. Meaning instead of just losing 33% Map Size, it's 3x33%. I'm not sure what the exact result for the map size is, either the game limits it or it's 1x0.67x0.67x0.67=30%, which sounds more reasonable (I made a math error in the video, when I said 13/14% I accidentally reduced it by 67% once, not 33%). As you can imagine, with such a tiny map the game becomes quite different - but more in an interesting way. Melee weapons become a lot more useful, but you will always have the enemies right in your face - and the -30% Speed loss from 3 times Old should also not be underestimated.

v6wY0P0IXcY.title: Bull with Blood Donation demolishes Danger 5 | Brotato Abyssal Terrors
v6wY0P0IXcY.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as Bull, a character that has to take damage to cause a high damage explosion around him. While the start is very simple due to his high HP, HP Regeneration and Armor bonus, it is rather quickly noticed that the increasing enemy damage starts becoming a problem since you need to get hit to explode to kill enemies. Probably the best way by far to deal with that is the Blood Donation - an item that gives you 40 Harvesting, but more importantly deals 1 damage to you per second, meaning the explosion gets triggered without the need of running into enemies, though to burst down strong enemies it can still be done to trigger several explosions a second. We also find another favorite item of mine on him, the Handcuffs. If the goal is just to beat the game, then the Handcuffs are one of the best item on him as long as you determine that you already have enough HP, so the later you find it the better. While it locks your HP, it also gives you 24 damage stats, which the ability of Bull multiplies by 3 - so 72 - and is further increased by %Damage and %Explosion Damage bonuses.

HKwB_5p-gYM.title: ONLY Curse Run turned me into a Sun God | Brotato Abyssal Terrors
HKwB_5p-gYM.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as Creature yet again - but this time a bit different. I was asked to do a Curse only run and after several not so fun attempts, I decided to give in and use the Cursed Characters mod, a mod that improves the upsides and decreases the downsides of every character. In our case this means we have overall better scaling, but the best thing is that we start with 2 cursed fishing hooks having a 28% chance to curse (each), and that our character looks cursed instead of normal. This does mean we won't be able to get to 100% Curse chance, but hey it's an amazing buff to the start. As we get through the run, one issue becomes apparent, which is that we struggle building up the right items compared to a normal run - so where a normal run curses e.g. all Tardigrades in the shop, you still get a huge amount out of crates. We don't. And worse: All the bad limited or unique items I just pick up to get them out of the way, this time I have to wait for them to appear and then waste a round to curse them.

✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7B0NqrHUe0yO1Hhx3qckULU
Today in Dungeon Clawler we play again as Chief Bunner going for Endless on Nightmare Mode - which also means we can now make use of Paws. Paws contain the main effect of the character it's from and any character can use any paws, a total of 3. So in our case we could retain a total of 300% Block: 50% from the character, 150% from 3x his paw, 100% from the Perk. But while the infinite scaling is nice, the real issue is the very first turn, where we need to make sure to reach enough Block to even survive. So for that I removed one of his paws to replace it with a paw that gives us a Harpoon - an insane Claw that double uses anything it picks up.

aNlTpmD3D34.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as Farmer - one of the characters that benefitted the most from the Curse mechanic, since he relies on picking up Fruits (at full HP), each giving 1 Harvesting, and thanks to the Curse the Gardens turn into machine guns shooting out tons of fruits per second - for each garden. While Harvesting no longer increases by the usual percentage per wave once Wave 20 is finished, you can of course still get Harvesting with other means, though at the same time you also lose 20% per wave. But as long as you earn a lot of Harvesting from Gardens that's not a big deal, since it will then cap out at 5x the value of Harvesting you get per wave (at that point the loss and gain is equal, so nothing changes anymore).

7I8d_BO71HA.title: Soldier beats ABYSS Danger 5 without Moving Once | Brotato Abyssal Terrors
7I8d_BO71HA.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Since Brotato received it's DLC Abyssal Terrors, one thing was imminent: that I would do another no movement challenge to beat the new map. In the past, we beat the old map on Danger 0 with the Bull https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O6mHpZSYRaQ and Danger 5 with Soldier https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7uq4bO2Dfe0
Today I decided to skip Danger 0 and jump right into Danger 5 and attempt to beat it yet again with the Soldier, a character that gains bonus stats and especially a huge amount of pickup range, just while standing still. While this run makes it look relatively simple - aside from the near death encounters - I would highly suggest everyone gives this a try to see just how much more difficult it has become on the new map. More ranged enemies, more dashers, cursed enemies receive a huge buff and almost no Elites allow to continue. But the one big new thing we have on our side is Curse, a mechanic that allows weapons and items to receive a multiplier to their stats, while also reducing negatives. Now if you ask me how we managed to win, I am honestly not exactly sure. It definitely relied on a specific item related to dodging, but I would haven ever expected that it would be enough to win.

DmgMeter: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3358859974

6VBYNyKktuY.title: 474 Bait 3973% Damage in ONLY 20 Waves | Brotato Abyssal Terrors
6VBYNyKktuY.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today in Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as the Fisherman with the Shredder and cover a recent topic we talked about: Taking every single Bait I come across. Though I want to take it a step further, I want to have as much Bait as possible. The difference? I won't shop and buy items that would be good, instead I want to use all of my money to roll and get more Bait. To achieve that we also implement a strategy to lock cheap weapons and items to get a free reroll - which happens when you empty out the shop. Free rerolls do not progress the reroll cost in the game, that means every reroll we save will save us a high cost reroll at the end - as long as what we spend on the items & weapons to buy is not higher than those reroll costs or rather the accumulated increase (if every reroll costs 5 more Material, then we save 5 Material on every future reroll we do, so it's not as simple as just looking the final cost).

DmgMeter: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3358859974
@ChaoticVice777 video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=muAZ4UjPg2A

wXx3O6bL35M.title: DEMON is now even MORE BORKEN than ever | Brotato Abyssal Terrors
wXx3O6bL35M.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today in Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play Demon, a character we always had a lot of fun with. The premise is quite simple: At the end of the wave, you turn 50% of your Material but divided by 13 into Health, so if you have 260 Material, 130/13=10 Health. The twist is that the character uses Health to buy things in the shop, meaning any other health bonuses you get is money. So if you use the Ghost Scepter that give you bonus health by killing enemies, you not only get money from killing, but also from getting more health.
The video referenced where we used Demon to hit wave 1000 that also explains a lot more on how to setup the run: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wvHETTCk86E

O7ayCwKYhlM.title: Extreme Speed Hiker with 6 Jousting Lances | Brotato Abyssal Terrors
O7ayCwKYhlM.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the new DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play the Hiker, overall a very interesting character that only receives half the material but makes that up by earning material the more you walk - except there are a few issues. For starters, the Hiker starts with -15% Speed, or rather -16.5% since Speed changes are increased by 10%. This means that you either go for the Jousting Lance or you focus on buffing up Speed to manage to survive the dashy and spammy enemy hordes. That's already where the first issue kicks in - since the Hiker gains half Material, we level up way less, and the material we earn by running around does not give experience. For comparison, Baby - a character that requires 200% more XP to level up - ends usually on level 23. We ended on level 16. So this is not a small thing that has a slight impact, but a major one since Speed is also mainly gained through level up choices. The character also gains bonus HP from running around and that one is fine or even too good, since you don't really have to care about HP anymore. I mean don't get me wrong, the way the character is he needs the HP bonus as it is, but I think it would be a lot more fun if steps would be increased to 100 or even 120, but the loss in Material is reduced to -25% or even removed - and the -15% Speed makes it extremely hard to play any other weapon but the Jousting Lance, so removing that would make the character a lot more fun.

Bx0mTjIe_n0.title: Cursed Sticks are broken! Chef with 6 Sticks vs Danger 5 | Brotato Abyssal Terrors
Bx0mTjIe_n0.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the new DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play the Chef to face Danger 5. The Chef is quite an interesting character where enemies have 100% bonus health, but burning enemies take 150% more damage - meaning as long as you can make them burn, they take 25% additional damage. I chose the Stick since they have a very high base damage and are cheap, meaning even without burning the enemies they can deal with most of them, but the moment a boss burns he will get nuked. And the most insane part of it? Cursed Sticks. Sticks gain bonus damage per Stick you have, but the cursed version gains even more damage, potentially even doubling it.

Today we take on the impossible challenge with Toastie, where we have to beat Room 1665. This doesn't sound as bad until you realize that Toastie has horrible stats, but the worst one being that Toastie has only 1 HP. And it really doesn't help that the starting weapon Peachone - as a solo weapon - is absolutely horrible to kickstart a run. Could it get any worse? Today we check out the new Brotato DLC Abyssal Terrors and play as Sailor. There are overall so many things introduced, so I will just focus on the key elements. The Sailor specializes in a weapon weapon type called Naval, for which he gains 200% bonus damage against cursed enemies. Curse is a new stat that can randomly increase the strength of an enemy (chance depends on Curse amount), but they also drop additional material. On top of that, Curse gives a chance that an item or weapon gets cursed, giving it bonus stats. As we notice in this run, if this mechanic gets cheesed in the right way, then it turns utterly broken.

Today I modded Brotato and combined Baby and Vagabond. Today I made a guide on beating Danger 5 in Brotato with the Arms Dealer, a character I consider the worst character in the game. I will state that I had far worse experiences with some other characters, but what makes him so horrible for me is that he takes the normal amount of RNG Brotato has (and it's quite high already) and multiplies that by a levels. My general strategy with him is to pick up as many items as possible that have a global effect, so something that would affect all weapons or help myself survive. I prefer killing over survivability, but this depends on what option I get. In this case I found the Sausage early on, so I knew we will always get value out of Elemental Damage, and that spiraled a bit out of control by assembling a perfect Turret build creation.

zGc8FBc11uQ.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today in Brotato Danger 5 I guide you through a win with Mutant - a character that got recently changed, instead of getting 200% bonus experience he requires 66% less to level up. At first this may seem like the same thing, but what that means is that bonus experience now has ridiculous impact. Prior, a 20% increase would mean you went from 300% experience gain to 320%, a tiny increase. Now a 20% increase means you go from 100% to 120%, but since we require only 1/3 of the XP to level up, it's worth 360% XP bonus.
We combine this with the Quarterstaff since it scales off of Level, gives bonus XP and also gives nice defensive bonuses - so I can fully focus on offensive values and farm the game.

boRIKCFaue4.description:

You asked for Engineer Baby and you get Engineer Baby. What is Engineer Baby? Well, Baby can have up to 24 weapons, starting with 1 weapon and adding a slot for every level up you get - the big downside is that you require 130% additional experience for level ups.
Initially I had big concerns since it's hard to get Engineering in the game and level ups are a major ressource for it, but on Baby the level ups are replaced with the additional weapon slots, meaning we have to get lucky in the shop. To my own surprise, the run turned out to be very simple on normal waves, though the Elites and final bossfight were huge issues. If someone gets proper items early enough, this should be a cakewalk, but without the level ups we also have big issues to build up HP and Armor, meaning it's also tough to survive.

4Gzxh6XtbS4.title: Legendary Excalibur gave -100 HP and I still won | Brotato Danger 5 Vagabond Guide
4Gzxh6XtbS4.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today we finally play Vagabond after I realized I never edited the original recording I had, and since it's been deleted I can't just upload it. In good old fashion we can't just normally play the game and instead I wrote down every weapon that exists in the game, put it into an Excel sheet and figured out a few builds that allow you to make use of 12 different traits - that's what the Vagabond is all about. He can't have the same weapon multiple times, but each weapon counts for every trait, so a weapon like the SMG being a Gun still counts for the Slingshot trait Primitive, so if someone has these 2 weapons then Primitive and Gun will both be at level 2. For a while everything works out according to the plan - and honestly way better than expected - but then it took a steep turn as I came across Excalibur, a legendary weapon. Which also has the Legendary trait that reduces HP by 20. But due to Vagabonds special ability, it's right away maxed out at -100, while also reducing armor by 18.

CeqhJixGGxU.title: Infinite Damage scaling into Shuriken destroys Danger 5 | Brotato One Armed Guide
CeqhJixGGxU.description:
✵Poll to vote on Character: https://strawpoll.com/1MnwkDw8kn7
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today we play One Armed and I share a more specific way of beating Danger 5 with One Armed, which is by stacking up %Damage with the help of the Ghost Axe, since One Armed doubles damage increases, so instead of 1% you get 2%. Since One Armed only has 1 weapon he has a lot less potential compared to other characters, as in he is a lot more limited - and that sadly also means that luck will play a bigger factor with him, since you can have a hard time getting the right weapons and upgrading yours.
The shown strategy is meant to counter this a bit by giving you insane Damage, so more weapons become viable, but it has a new weakness that you have to find a weapon to replace the Axe. I would recommend locking a weapon you want around wave 7/8, so you can buy it immediately after wave 9. I chose Shurikens here because I had a lot of Melee Damage, but without that I could have went for the SMG, Slingshot or pretty much anything that I scale up quickly with the double damage scaling and a starting 200% Damage boost.

dMpDTc_m8NI.title: Santa Water ONLY vs 8886% Curse reaches new Record | Vampire Survivors
dMpDTc_m8NI.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DuJpa1e8YUnaPTSoHyVI7S
After a long time we finally check out Santa Water again in Vampire Survivors - a weapon that has a very long history on my channel. Since there were a bunch of new Arcanas with the introduction of Darkasso we are able to take it to whole new extremes, however we are sadly more limited than it seems. Initially I planned to go for Bolero and did so, but since we need 2 scaling Arcanas as fast as possible, Bolero actually backfires and hurts us. With Inverse Mode we can guarantee to get 4 Arcanas, but with Bolero we are at the mercy of random spawns whether we will get them in time or not. To understand, we need Silent Old Sanctuary, Wicked Season and Boogaloo of Illusions. Meaning we could reset the stage until we spawn with 1 and reset until there is also one on the 1st minute, but that will take a huge amount of time to achieve and just for a chance at additional Arcanas. So I determined in this case it's not worth it and we will play it the regular way, but of course while also making use of the new Arcana Sapphire Mist, that allows us to multi-trigger weapons. It doesn't matter for Santa Water at all, pretty much, but our scaling will be way higher thanks to it, since it multi-triggers Paranormal Scan - each time giving us a random stat boost, of which we mostly look for Might.

VS Mod used: https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/87?tab=description

But instead of normal difficulty, I wanted to do it on Nightmare Difficulty. Before the run I did consider what I want to do, but the plan was rather rough: Get the magnetic claw combined with Count Clawcula, since that means we can do very quick and large grabs to attack. The lifesteal will keep as alive as long as we don't lose in a single big attack. On level ups I wanted to have at least 1 magnet, but the rest is just whatever metallic thing we can get that is not too big - the last thing we want to have is issues with big metallic weapons and the magnet, for example that it gets stuck or just due to size causes items to fall off.

tGSlGsL8WDY.title: 6 MINIGUNS with 252 Ranged Damage on Cyborg Danger 5 | Brotato
tGSlGsL8WDY.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today we play the Cyborg after I got tipped off by @Gigawood and @risingtoastcheesecake4730  to use him with the new item Nail, which converts 20% of the Engineering we have into weapon damage. The Cyborg has a 350% Ranged Damage multiplier, but converts it halfway in a 1:2 ratio into Engineering, which usually makes his ranged weapons - one of which being a Minigun he starts with - useless, however with the Nail we can still use the ridiculous Ranged Damage scaling. Math wise, each point of Ranged Damage is worth 3.5 Ranged Damage, which is then converted into 7 Engineering. 20% of that is then turned into weapon damage, so even at our weakest point we still get 1.4 Ranged Damage out of each point of Ranged Damage we pick up - and since the Minigun is one of if not the fastest firing weapon in the game, it can make perfect use of the stat.

s3POIIw4Pqg.title: These Arcana turn BRACELET into a Broken Weapon | Vampire Survivors
s3POIIw4Pqg.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DuJpa1e8YUnaPTSoHyVI7S
Today we limit break Bracelet again, a weapon that I call the worst weapon in the game, or rather Gyorunton - the character associated with the weapon as it's his starting weapon. However, this time we pull out a full financial support, the kind of life support that would keep even the most lost cause alive - Moonlight Bolero forcing a starting Arcana, turning off Inverse Mode and going ham by getting an unreasonable amount of Arcanas. Moonlight Bolero, Silent Old Sanctuary, Wicked Season, Sapphire Mist, Heart of Fire, Jail of Crystal, Crystal Cries. Yes, you heard that right, a total of 7 Arcana were used here and it pains me to say that, but the Tri-Bracelet not only performed well, but it's performance was incredibely on the hard waves.
One thing that has to be stated though: In the past we used Inverse Mode to gain a 4th Arcana we would usually not have. The upside is that we scale faster and become stronger, but the 200% bonus HP on the enemies is no joke. Most weapons can deal with this until the hardcore waves appear, but with Moonlight Bolero and a decent amount of luck, this is not a requirement anymore to get an additional Arcana. However, the big downside is that 3 additional Arcana are needed to make it worth it - 1 to re-pay the investment of Moonlight Bolero, 1 to compensate for the loss of the 4th Arcana, and another 1 to actually have more Arcanas than without Moonlight Bolero. Since 1 can be forced in by resetting the game, "only" 2 additional Arcana are needed, however it is a gamble whether this actually happens and also when - since getting a growing Arcana at 25 minutes won't help anymore.

VS Mod used: https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/87?tab=description

MsTpavz5RAk.title: How INSANE is a 5 Godly FORGED BLADE Build?! | Oaken Tower

Today in Oaken Tower I finally manage to do an Anvil build with a quick pivot after starting with a gold build. The Anvil gains 1 stack per sword when it triggers, at 20 stacks it creates a random forged blade. These blades range from decent to out right broken, especially when combined with each other as they give a lot of bonuses to swords. But how do we get a ton of swords to trigger more of the anvil? Simple: We give it multihit. The only thing we need now is to not kill the enemies too fast...

Oaken Tower is a synergy-heavy PvP autobattler where your tower of items fights other players. Build deadly combos and scale exponentially. Every decision matters.

Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EEJNOI3TfiI&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7BA_d8ve4ahFTxBjaqgvlPa

z6ml6cC_TNI.title: How Linoone won my first PokeRogue Classic Run
z6ml6cC_TNI.description:
As an oldschool Pokemon fan, I wanted to give PokeRogue a try after seeing it a couple of times all over YouTube and becoming more and more intrigued by it's design. Little did I know that the game would immediately hook me, up to an extend I'd rather skip sleep to play more.

If you don't know PokeRogue, just imagine you play Pokemon but skip all the walking. Classic Mode has 200 stages and after each stage, you get to shop, balancing to maintain a healthy team but also not to run out of money. After every 10th stage you get fully healed, but before that either a Boss Pokemon or a Gym battle is waiting, having to carefully balance how much you need for a fight you don't know yet. But the biggest problem of it all: Ivy, your rival. Ivy starts off rather as a sleeper, rarely causing a loss, but she picks up a boss-equivalent Rayquaza that can wipe out entire teams on it's own.

While you'd expect the hero of the story would be some very strong Pokemon or a smart abuse of game mechanics, it all came down to an easily forgotten friend.

wBRzpY1xFEk.title: Secret Weapon VS Maruto 12.715.080 HP Record | Vampire Survivors
wBRzpY1xFEk.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DuJpa1e8YUnaPTSoHyVI7S
Today we take on the HP Record with Crimson Shroud, a secret weapon in Vampire Survivors (well, as secret as secret characters that the game tells you about...). The plan is quite simple: Crimson Shroud is the only retaliatory weapon in the game that ONLY has retaliatory damage, all other weapons have mixed attack forms, meaning these steal from each other. But this comes at a cost: We have to pick up 1 Health scaling item to evolve Laurel and Crimson Shroud is also a very slow start. And a newly discovered issue: Paranormal Scan keeps giving random stats, including Revivals, so it's actually very beneficial to keep the run going. Crimson Shroud however triggers the White Hand upon killing the Reaper, where you die back to back and can't move at all, meaning way less time to get more Revival stats.

Today we continue the challenge to win the game without weapons and movement, however this time on Inverse Mode, which triples the HP of the enemies. While this initially just sounds like an additional burden, it quickly turns out the main issue is how restricting it is. Not only do bosses live 3 times as long, but also the damage threshold required to oneshot enemies - or those that can't be oneshot anymore - is raised by quite a lot, meaning I am forced to take additional armor points just to make sure some enemies get oneshot.

hYAoKSrUipg.title: 0 Weapons with 0 Movement in the goold old Library Vampire Survivors
hYAoKSrUipg.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DuJpa1e8YUnaPTSoHyVI7S
Today we attempt a very straightforward challenge: 0 weapons with 0 movement, back on the good old library. Though the challenge itself is anything but simple, as the starts have to align to make this properly work. An early boss attacks you and doesn't get pushed away? Done. You don't get Awake, a random chest that has to drop on you? Done. You don't have enough Revivals left for the hardcore bosses at 20 minutes and especially 25 minutes? Done. You sneeze and accidentally move? Done. But, as it turns out, in the very first attempt without inverse mode - after hours and hours of failed inverse mode, but with a lot of gathered knowledge - the stars align just right.

alooF9nE3EE.title: Insane 1292 Kills/SECOND & 780,864 Damage hits | Vampire Survivors Operation Guns
alooF9nE3EE.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DuJpa1e8YUnaPTSoHyVI7S
Today we check out the new DLC of the Contra collab Operation Guns in Vampire Survivors as Sheena and hit it off hard by hitting all-time highs. She starts with the weapon Blade Crossbow which evolves into BFC2000-AD (yes I'm not kidding), however the weapon has 2 interesting effects. The first one is that it has a divine intervention effect based on luck, or rather luck increases it's frequency, where a beam appears and she throws shurikens. But more interesting is what seems to be an extreme crit that has several multitudes. My theory is it's based on the enemy HP and less of a random range for crit, but so far I am uncertain.

3iF_OH5jn_c.title: I assembled the Mutlicast Gods in 1 Build in Oaken Tower
3iF_OH5jn_c.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vApiI3Ez6A&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7AiSFN60y-_fm7JlW04peCe
Today in Oaken Tower we start rather calm with the Lunar Codex, a weapon that gains bonus Multicast every time you level up. The goal was to get an artifact that gives the Lunar Codex 4 bonus damage each time it triggers, but after we couldn't find it and stumbled across the Trigem, I decided to give it a shot. The Trigem gives 5 damage to every item - including non-weapons - when it triggers, the issue is you can't have a duplicate tag, like 2 magic weapons, 2 elven etc. Luckily we randomed into Bat Wing, a legendary bow that gets 3 Multicast at the start of the fight, and round it up with the Astral Hammer, a legendary hammer that has a ton of attacks and usually you want to reduce it's cooldown to 1 second by having 4 Mace equipped. Combined, we have the ultimate Multicast Gods assembled in one build that make heavy use of the bonus damage we stack up.

Oaken Tower is a synergy-heavy PvP autobattler where your tower of items fights other players. Build deadly combos and scale exponentially. Every decision matters.
